page.title: 04HULLS MARINA
page.content: Hulls Marina was opened in 1983 and is in two sections, each of which was once a dock. The larger of the two docks, the first to play host to leisure craft such as yachts, was the Humber dock and it covers 7 acres. It was built in 1803 and gave Hull its first enclosed dock with direct access to the Humber. At present the Marina has 330 berths which can accommodate boats of 15ft to those of 75ft in length. Access to the Marina is via some modern lock gates from the River Humber. The prices for berthing in the Marina are: rent for 1 year is Â£18 per foot per boat with a minimum charge of Â£360, you can rent a berth for 3 months at a rate of Â£6 per foot with a minimum charge of Â£150. These prices don't include VAT.
